humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the largest dimension of the invasive component of the tumor is 3.0 cm. Based on the rules provided, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage of a cancer is determined by the size of the primary tumor. In this report, the greatest dimension of the tumor is measured as 3.0 cm. According to the TNM staging system for cancer, a T2 stage is given to tumors that are greater than 2 cm in size but not greater than 5 cm. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.
